text:
Hello!
I just started with HS and working on a fresh pc /w VS code and the VS HS extension.
Has anyone else encountered this "Invalid usage of..." error that occurs in the .html files? And if you have, did you solve it somehow? I saw there is an older, unsolved 2021 github report mentioning it.
Hi there, is this error occurring in a module.html file?

<@U26B530N6> When I open any .html file that I have never been inside before (boilerplate) it starts giving the red warning. :man-shrugging: It's a fresh VS code and HS VS extension - no other extensions that could clutter it up.

Reproduce: enter any .html file, add e.g. a whitespace anywhere, save, get the error.
<https://gyazo.com/503b6b509e525865c3321aa40aedc3c0>

Thank you for the context! I’m trying to reproduce this on my end. Do you mind sharing the path of a file that’s not working? For example
`cms-theme-boilerplate/src/modules/button.module/module.html`

One example with .html file inside "modules" folder:
```projectname\modules\card.module\module.html```
Thankyou. Are you using Windows by chance?
Gotcha, thank you! I will try to reproduce this

In
```projectname\templates\partials\footer.html```
it gives a yellow warning
Thanks. I hopefully have a fix on the first issue in the works and I think I know what’s causing this one. Appreciate the info
